setting.name: 24HourClock
setting.label: 24 Hour format
setting.description: If 1, time is display using hour range 0-24, otherwise 1-12 AM/PM.

setting.name: date.format
setting.label: Format
setting.description: Controls format of date string. D = day of week d = day M = month Up to two comma's may be included. e.g. D,dM = Thursday, 3 July Md,D = July 3, Thursday The field may contain 0, 1 or 2 comma's which can occur only between characters and only one at a time i.e. 'D,,dM' is illegal.

setting.name: date.longFormat
setting.description: If checked, display the day and month in long format (Friday/November), otherwise, use abbreviations (Fri/Nov).

setting.name: date.dateTop
setting.description: If checked, display date above time else display time above date.

setting.name: headsetMode
setting.description: If checked, the headset will be selected as the preferred transducer after its first use until the headset key is pressed again; otherwise, handsfree will be selected preferentially over the headset.

setting.name: useDirectoryNames
setting.description: If checked, the name fields of directory entries which match incoming calls will be used for caller identification display and in the call lists instead of the name provided via network signaling.

setting.name: oneTouchVoiceMail
setting.description: If checked, the voicemail summary display is bypassed and voicemail is dialed directly (if configured).

setting.name: welcomeSoundEnabled
setting.description: If checked, play welcome sound effect after a reboot.

setting.name: welcomeSoundOnWarmBootEnabled
setting.description: If checked, play welcome sound effect on warm as well as cold boots, otherwise only a cold boot will trigger the welcome sound effect.

setting.name: localClockEnabled
setting.description: If checked, display the date and time on the idle display

setting.name: level
setting.description: Level of the high frequency component of the DTMF digit measured in dBm0; the low frequency tone will be two dB lower.

setting.name: onTime
setting.description: When a sequence of DTMF tones is played out automatically, this is the length of time in milliseconds the tones will be generated for; this is also the minimum time the tone will be played for when dialing manually (even if key press is shorter).

setting.name: offTime
setting.description: When a sequence of DTMF tones is played out automatically, this is the length of time in milliseconds the phone will pause between digits; this is also the minimum inter-digit time when dialing manually.

setting.name: chassis.masking
setting.description: If checked, DTMF tones will be substituted with a non-DTMF pacifier tone when dialing in hands-free mode. This prevents DTMF digits being broadcast to other surrounding telephony devices or being inadvertently transmitted in-band due to local acoustic echo. Note: tone.dtmf.chassis.masking should only be enabled when tone.dtmf.viaRtp is disabled.

setting.name: stim.pac.offHookOnly
setting.description: Not currently used.

setting.name: viaRtp
setting.description: If checked, encode DTMF in the active RTP stream, otherwise, DTMF may be encoded within the signaling protocol only when the protocol offers the option. Note: tone.dtmf.chassis.masking should be enabled when tone.dtmf.viaRtp is disabled.

setting.name: rfc2833Control
setting.description: If checked, the phone will indicate a preference for encoding DTMF via RFC 2833 format in its Session Description Protocol (SDP) offers by showing support for the phone-event payload type; this does not affect SDP answers, these will always honor the DTMF format present in the offer since the phone has native support for RFC 2833.

setting.name: rfc2833Payload
setting.description: The phone-event payload encoding in the dynamic range to be used in SDP offers.

group.name: se
group.label: Sound Effects
group.description: SoundPoint(R) IP uses both synthesized (based on the chord-sets described earlier) and sampled audio sound effects. Sound effects are defined by patterns: rudimentary sequences of chord-sets, silence periods, and wave files.

setting.name: stutterOnVoiceMail
setting.description: If checked, stuttered dial tone is used in place of normal dial tone to indicate that one or more messages (voice-mail) are waiting at the message center.

setting.name: appLocalEnabled
setting.description: If checked, local user interface sound effects such as confirmation/error tones, will be enabled.

setting.name: G711Mu
setting.description: Specifies the codec preference. 1=highest 3=lowest Null=do not use Give each codec a unique priority, this will dictate the order used in SDP negotiations. Note: If less than two codecs are specified, SoundPoint(R) IP will automatically use G711Mu and G711A with default parameters.

setting.name: G711A
setting.description: Specifies the codec preference. 1=highest 3=lowest Null=do not use Give each codec a unique priority, this will dictate the order used in SDP negotiations. Note: If less than two codecs are specified, SoundPoint(R) IP will automatically use G711Mu and G711A with default parameters.

setting.name: G729AB
setting.description: Specifies the codec preference. 1=highest 3=lowest Null=do not use Give each codec a unique priority, this will dictate the order used in SDP negotiations. Note: If less than two codecs are specified, SoundPoint(R) IP will automatically use G711Mu and G711A with default parameters.

setting.name: payloadSize
setting.description: Preferred Tx payload size in milliseconds to be provided in SDP offers and used in the absence of ptime negotiations. This is also the range of supported Rx payload sizes.

setting.name: jitterBufferMin
setting.description: The smallest jitter buffer depth (in milliseconds) that must be achieved before play out begins for the first time. Once this depth has been achieved initially, the depth may fall below this point and play out will still continue. This parameter should be set to the smallest possible value which is at least two packet payloads, and larger than the expected short term average jitter.

setting.name: jitterBufferShrink
setting.description: The absolute minimum duration time (in milliseconds) of RTP packet Rx with no packet loss between jitter buffer size shrinks. Use smaller values (1000 ms) to minimize the delay on known good networks. Use larger values to minimize packet loss on networks with large jitter (3000 ms).

setting.name: jitterBufferMax
setting.description: The largest jitter buffer depth to be supported (in milliseconds). Jitter above this size will always cause lost packets. This parameter should be set to the smallest possible value that will support the expected network jitter

setting.name: payloadSize
setting.description: Preferred Tx payload size in milliseconds to be provided in SDP offers and used in the absence of ptime negotiations. This is also the range of supported Rx payload sizes.

setting.name: jitterBufferMin
setting.description: The smallest jitter buffer depth (in milliseconds) that must be achieved before play out begins for the first time. Once this depth has been achieved initially, the depth may fall below this point and play out will still continue. This parameter should be set to the smallest possible value which is at least two packet payloads, and larger than the expected short term average jitter.

setting.name: jitterBufferShrink
setting.description: The absolute minimum duration time (in milliseconds) of RTP packet Rx with no packet loss between jitter buffer size shrinks. Use smaller values (1000 ms) to minimize the delay on known good networks. Use larger values to minimize packet loss on networks with large jitter (3000 ms).

setting.name: jitterBufferMax
setting.description: The largest jitter buffer depth to be supported (in milliseconds). Jitter above this size will always cause lost packets. This parameter should be set to the smallest possible value that will support the expected network jitter

setting.name: payloadSize
setting.description: Preferred Tx payload size in milliseconds to be provided in SDP offers and used in the absence of ptime negotiations. This is also the range of supported Rx payload sizes.

setting.name: jitterBufferMin
setting.description: The smallest jitter buffer depth (in milliseconds) that must be achieved before play out begins for the first time. Once this depth has been achieved initially, the depth may fall below this point and play out will still continue. This parameter should be set to the smallest possible value which is at least two packet payloads, and larger than the expected short term average jitter.

setting.name: jitterBufferShrink
setting.description: The absolute minimum duration time (in milliseconds) of RTP packet Rx with no packet loss between jitter buffer size shrinks. Use smaller values (1000 ms) to minimize the delay on known good networks. Use larger values to minimize packet loss on networks with large jitter (3000 ms).

setting.name: jitterBufferMax
setting.description: The largest jitter buffer depth to be supported (in milliseconds). Jitter above this size will always cause lost packets. This parameter should be set to the smallest possible value that will support the expected network jitter

group.name: volume
group.label: Volume Persistence
group.description: The user's selection of the receive volume during a call can be remembered between calls. This can be configured per termination (handset, headset and handsfree/chassis). In some countries regulations exist which dictate that receive volume should be reset to nominal at the start of each call on handset and headset.

setting.name: persist.handset
setting.description: If checked, the receive volume will be remembered between calls. If set to 0, the receive volume will be reset to nominal at the start of each call.

setting.name: persist.headset
setting.description: If checked, the receive volume will be remembered between calls. If set to 0, the receive volume will be reset to nominal at the start of each call.

setting.name: persist.handsfree
setting.description: If checked, the receive volume will be remembered between calls. If set to 0, the receive volume will be reset to nominal at the start of each call.

group.name: vad
group.label: Voice Activity Detection
group.description: These settings control the performance of the voice activity detection (silence suppression) feature

setting.name: vadEnable
setting.description: If checked, enable VAD.

setting.name: vadThresh
setting.description: The threshold for determining what is active voice and what is background noise in dB. This does not apply to G.729AB codec operation which has its own built-in VAD function.

setting.name: rtp.user_priority
setting.description: User-priority used for RTP packets.

setting.name: callControl.user_priority
setting.description: User-priority used for call control packets.

setting.name: other.user_priority
setting.description: User-priority used for packets that do not have a per-protocol setting.

setting.name: min_delay
setting.description: If checked, set min-delay bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: max_throughput
setting.description: If checked, set max-throughput bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: max_reliability
setting.description: If checked, set max-reliability bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: min_cost
setting.description: If checked, set min-cost bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: precedence
setting.description: If checked, set precedence bits in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set them.

setting.name: min_delay
setting.description: If checked, set min-delay bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: max_throughput
setting.description: If checked, set max-throughput bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: max_reliability
setting.description: If checked, set max-reliability bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: min_cost
setting.description: If checked, set min-cost bit in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set it.

setting.name: precedence
setting.description: If checked, set precedence bits in the IP TOS field of the IP header, or else don't set them.

group.name: tcpIpApp.sntp
group.label: SNTP
group.description: The following table describes the parameters used to set up time synchronization and daylight savings time. The defaults shown will enable daylight savings time for North America. Daylight savings defaults

setting.name: resyncPeriod
setting.description: Time in seconds between SNTP re-syncs.

setting.name: address
setting.description: Address of the SNTP server.

setting.name: gmtOffset
setting.description: Offset in seconds of the local time zone from GMT. Note: 3600 seconds per hour

setting.name: daylightSavings.enable
setting.description: If checked, apply daylight savings rules to displayed time.

setting.name: daylightSavings.fixedDayEnable
setting.description: If checked, 'April 1st' is used, otherwise 'the first Sunday in April' is used.

setting.name: daylightSavings.start.month
setting.description: Month to start DST. 1=Jan, 2=Feb, ..., 12=Dec

setting.name: daylightSavings.start.date
setting.description: Day of the month to start DST.

setting.name: daylightSavings.start.time
setting.description: Time of day to start DST, in 24 hour clock. 2=2 am, 14=2 pm

setting.name: daylightSavings.start.dayOfWeek
setting.description: Day of week to apply DST. 1=Mon, 2=Tue, ..., 7=Sun

setting.name: daylightSavings.start.dayOfWeek.lastInMonth
setting.description: If checked and fixedDayEnable is checked, start DST on the last day of the week (specified by dayOfWeek) in the month, rather than the first in the month.

setting.name: daylightSavings.stop.month
setting.description: Month to stop DST. 1=Jan, 2=Feb, ..., 12=Dec

setting.name: daylightSavings.stop.date
setting.description: Day of the month to start DST.

setting.name: daylightSavings.stop.time
setting.description: Time of day to stop DST, in 24 hour clock. 2= 2 am, 14=2 pm

setting.name: daylightSavings.stop.dayOfWeek
setting.description: Day of week to stop DST. 1=Mon, 2=Tue, ..., 7=Sun

setting.name: daylightSavings.stop.dayOfWeek.lastInMonth
setting.description: If checked and fixedDayEnable=0, stop DST on the last day of the week (specified by dayOfWeek) in the month, rather than the first in the month.

setting.name: filterByIp
setting.description: If checked, reject RTP packets arriving from (sent from) a non-negotiated (via SDP) IP address.

setting.name: filterByPort
setting.description: If checked, reject RTP packets arriving from (sent from) a non-negotiated (via SDP) port.

setting.name: forceSend
setting.description: When not empty, send all RTP packets to, and expect all RTP packets to arrive on, the specified port. Note: both tcpIpApp.port.rtp.filterByIp and tcpIpApp.port.rtp.filterByPort must be enabled for this to work.

setting.name: mediaPortRangeStart
setting.description: If empty, the value 2222 will be used for the first allocated RTP port, otherwise, the specified port will be used. Subsequent ports will be allocated from a pool starting with the specified port plus two up to a value of (start-port + 46), after which the port number will wrap back to the starting value.

setting.name: enabled
setting.description: If checked, the HTTP server will be enabled.

setting.name: enabled
setting.description: If checked, the HTTP server configuration interface will be enabled.

setting.name: port
setting.description: Port is 80 for HTTP servers. Care should be taken when choosing an alternate port.

setting.name: donotdisturb.perReg
setting.label: Do Not Disturb
setting.description: If checked, the DND feature will allow selection of DND on a per-registration basis.

setting.name: rejectBusyOnDnd
setting.description: If checked, reject all incoming calls with the reason 'busy' if do-not-disturb is enabled.

setting.name: enableOnNotRegistered
setting.description: If checked, calls will be allowed when the phone is not successfully registered, otherwise, calls will not be permitted without a valid registration.

setting.name: offeringTimeOut
setting.description: Time in seconds to allow an incoming call to ring before dropping the call, 0=infinite.

setting.name: ringBackTimeOut
setting.description: Time in seconds to allow an outgoing call to remain in the ringback state before dropping the call, 0=infinite.

setting.name: lastCallReturnString
setting.description: The string sent to the server when the user selects the 'last call return' action.

setting.name: disableDivert
setting.description: If checked, disable diversion feature for shared lines.

setting.name: seizeFailReorder
setting.description: If checked, play reorder tone locally on shared line seize failure.

setting.name: oneTouchResume
setting.description: If checked, when a shared line has a call on hold the remote user can press that line and resume the call. If more than one call is on hold on the line then the first one will be selected and resumed automatically. If set to 0, pressing the shared line will bring up a list of the calls on that line and the user can select which call the next action should be applied to. The call diversion, no answer feature will take precedence over this feature if enabled.

setting.name: enabled
setting.description: If checked, periodically notify the local user that calls have been on hold for an extended period of time.

setting.name: period
setting.description: Time in seconds between subsequent reminders.

setting.name: startDelay
setting.description: Time in seconds to wait before the initial reminder.

setting.name: scrolling.timeout
setting.description: The time-out after which a key that is enabled for scrolling will go into scrolling mode until the key is released. Keys enabled for scrolling are menu navigation keys (left, right, up, down arrows), volume keys, and some context-specific soft keys. The value is an integer multiple of 500 milliseconds (1=500ms).

setting.name: level.change.sip
setting.description: This attribute controls the logging detail level for the SIP component. These are the input filters for the internal memory-based log system.

setting.name: level
setting.description: Specifies the lowest class of event that will be rendered to the log files. This is the output filter from the internal memory-based log system.

setting.name: type
setting.description: See above table for timestamp type.

setting.name: realtime
setting.description: Set to 1. Do not change.

setting.name: stdout
setting.description: Set to 1. Do not change.

setting.name: file
setting.description: Set to 1. Do not change.

setting.name: file.size
setting.description: Maximum local application log file size in Kbytes. When this size is exceeded, the file is uploaded to the boot server and the local copy is erased.

setting.name: file.upload.period
setting.description: Time in seconds between log file uploads to the boot server. Note: The log file will not be uploaded if no new events have been logged since the last upload.

setting.name: file.upload.append
setting.description: If checked, use append mode when uploading log files to server.

setting.name: file.upload.append.sizeLimit
setting.description: Maximum log file size on boot server in Kbytes.

setting.name: file.upload.append.limitMode
setting.description: Behavior when server log file has reached its limit. delete=delete file and start over, stop=stop appending to file.

group.name: sec
group.label: Security
group.description: These settings affect security aspects of SoundPoint(R) IP.

setting.name: tagSerialNo
setting.description: If checked, the phone may advertise its serial number (Ethernet address) via protocol signaling.

setting.name: admin
setting.description: Password changes will need to be at least this long. Use 0 to allow null passwords.

setting.name: user
setting.description: Password changes will need to be at least this long. Use 0 to allow null passwords.

setting.name: type
setting.description: Defines the strategy to adopt before a request gets executed. If set to 'audio', a request can be executed as soon as there is no active audio on the phone, independently of any call state. If set to 'call', a request can be executed as soon as there are no calls in any state on the phone.

group.name: mb
group.label: MicroBrowser
group.description: These settings control the home page and proxy to be used by the MicroBrowser when it is selected to provide services and also when it is used as part of the Idle Display. They also control size limits and the Idle Display refresh rate.

setting.name: proxy
setting.description: Address of the desired HTTP proxy to be used by the MicroBrowser. If blank, normal unproxied HTTP is used by the MicroBrowser.

setting.name: home
setting.description: URL used for MicroBrowser idle display home-page. Example: http://www.example.com/ xhtml/frontpage.cgi?page=home. If empty, there will be no microbrowser idle display feature. Note that the MicroBrowser idle display will displace the idle display indicator. See Indicators settings.

setting.name: refresh
setting.description: The period in seconds between refreshes of the idle display MicroBrowser's content. 0 = the idle display MicroBrowser is not refreshed. Minimum refresh period = 5 seconds (values from 1 to 4 will be ignored, and 5 will be used instead) Notes: If an HTTP Refresh header is detected, it will be respected, even if this parameter is set to 0. The use of this parameter in combination with the Refresh HTTP header may cause the idle display to refresh at unexpected times.

setting.name: home
setting.description: URL used for MicroBrowser home-page. If blank, the browser will notify the user that a blank home-page was used. Example: http://www.example.com/ xhtml/frontpage.cgi?page=home.

setting.name: nodes
setting.description: Limits the number of tags which the XML parser will handle. This limits the amount of memory used by complicated pages. The Services browser and the Idle Display each use memory defined by this limit. A maximum total of 500 (256 each) is recommended. Increasing this value may have a detrimental effect on performance of the phone.

setting.name: cache
setting.description: Limits the total size of objects downloaded for each page (both XHTML and images). Once this limit is reached, no more images are downloaded until the next page is requested. Units = kBytes. Increasing this value may have a detrimental effect on performance of the phone.

setting.name: address
setting.label: Server
setting.description: IP address or host name and port of a SIP server to which the phone shall send all requests for making calls.

setting.name: port
setting.label: Local Port
setting.description: Local port for sending and receiving SIP signaling packets. If set to 0 or Null, 5060 is used for the local port but it is not advertised in the SIP signaling. If set to some other value, that value is used for the local port and it is advertised in the SIP signaling.

setting.name: useRFC2543hold
setting.description: If checked, use the obsolete c=0.0.0.0 RFC2543 technique, otherwise, use SDP media direction attributes (such as a=sendonly) per RFC 3264 when initiating hold. In either case, the phone processes incoming hold signaling in either format.

setting.name: lcs
setting.description: If checked, the proprietary 'epid' parameter is added to the From field of all requests to support Windows Live Communications Server.

setting.name: sendCompactHdrs
setting.description: If set to 0, SIP header names generated by the phone use the long form, for example 'From'. If set to 1, SIP header names generated by the phone use the short form, for example 'f'.

setting.name: WM50
setting.description: Windows Messaging 5.0 Compatability

group.name: alertInfo
group.label: Alert Information
group.description: Match incoming call's alert information to a particular ring response. NOTE: Currently only 1 alert type is supported

setting.name: value
setting.description: Alert-Info fields from INVITE requests will be compared against with this value and if a match is found, the behavior described in the corresponding ring class will be applied.

setting.name: class
setting.description: one of these four valid values: ring, visual, answer, or ring-answer

group.name: requestValidation
group.label: Request Validation
group.description: To guard against unauthorized callers or telephony events. NOTE: Currently only 1 event type is supported

setting.name: request
setting.description: One of: 'INVITE', 'ACK', 'BYE', 'REGISTER', 'CANCEL', 'OPTIONS', 'INFO', 'MESSAGE', 'SUBSCRIBE', 'NOTIFY', 'REFER', 'PRACK', or 'UPDATE'. Sets the name of the method for which validation will be applied. WARNING: Intensive request validation may have a negative performance impact due to the additional signaling required in some cases, therefore, use it judiciously.

setting.name: method
setting.description: Null or one of: 'source', 'digest' or 'both'/'all'. If Null, no validation is done. Otherwise this sets the type of validation performed for the request: source: ensure request is received from an IP address of a server belonging to the set of target registration servers; digest: challenge requests with digest authentication using the local credentials for the associated registration (line); both or all: apply both of the above methods

setting.name: request.1.event
setting.description: Determines which events specified with the Event header should be validated; only applicable when request is set to 'SUBSCRIBE' or 'NOTIFY'. If set to Null, all events will be validated.

group.name: digest
group.description: Credentials for incoming requests, if request validation is enabled.

setting.name: realm
setting.description: Determines string used for Realm.

setting.name: lineSeize.nonStandard
setting.description: If checked, process a 200 OK response for a line-seize event SUBSCRIBE as though a line-seize NOTIFY with Subscription State: active header had been received, this speeds up processing.

setting.name: checkSync.alwaysReboot
setting.description: If checked, always reboot when a NOTIFY message is received from the server with event equal to check-sync. If set to 0, only reboot if any of the files listed in [mac].cfg have changed on the FTP server when a NOTIFY message is received from the server with event equal to check-sync.

setting.name: address
setting.description: If Null, conferences are set up on the phone locally. If set to some value, conferences are set up by the server using the conferencing agent specified by this address. The acceptable values depend on the conferencing server implementation policy.

group.name: dialplan
group.label: Dial Plan
group.description: Dialplan for all lines on this phone. Each line may be configured independenty, see that lines settings.

setting.name: impossibleMatchHandling
setting.description: If set to 0, the digits entered up to and including the point where an impossible match occurred are sent to the server immediately. If checked, give reorder tone. If set to 2, allow user to accumulate digits and dispatch call manually with the Send soft key.

setting.name: removeEndOfDial
setting.description: If checked, strip trailing # digit from digits sent out.

setting.name: digitmap
setting.description: When this attribute is present, number-only dialing during the setup phase of new calls will be compared against the patterns therein and if a match is found, the call will be initiated automatically eliminating the need to press Send.

setting.name: digitmap.timeOut
setting.label: Time out
setting.description: Timeout in seconds for 'T' feature of digitmap.

setting.name: address
setting.description: IP address or host name and port of a SIP server that will be used for routing calls.

setting.name: emergency.1.value
setting.label: Emergency Numbers
setting.description: This determines the URLs that should be watched for. When one of these defined URLs is detected as having been dialed by the user, the call will automatically be directed to the defined emergency server.

group.name: msg
group.label: Messaging
group.description: SoundPoint(R) IP supports message-waiting indication on a per-registration basis.

setting.name: bypassInstantMessage
setting.description: If checked, the display offering a choice of 'Message Center' and 'Instant Messages' will be bypassed when pressing the Messages key, the phone will act as if 'Message Center' was chosen. See 3.6.1 Voicemail Integration on page 49. Instant Messages will still be accessible from the Main Menu.

group.name: nat
group.label: NAT
group.description: These parameters define port and IP address changes used in NAT traversal. The port changes will change the port used by the phone, while the IP entry simply changes the IP advertised in the SIP signaling. This allows the use of simple NAT devices that can redirect traffic, but do not allow for port mapping. For example, port 5432 on the NAT device can be sent to port 5432 on an internal device, but not port 1234.

setting.name: ip
setting.description: IP address to advertise within SIP signaling, should match the external IP address used by the NAT device.

setting.name: signalPort
setting.description: If non-Null, this port will be used by the phone for SIP signaling, overriding the value set for RTP Settings

setting.name: mediaPortStart
setting.description: If non-Null, this attribute will be used to set the initially allocated RTP port, overriding the value set in RTP Settings.

setting.name: displayName
setting.description: Display name used for local user interface as well as SIP signaling.

setting.name: address
setting.label: User Address
setting.description: user (e.g. '1002'), the implied domain will be the registration server.

setting.name: label
setting.description: Text label to appear on the display adjacent to the associated line key. If omitted, the label will be derived from the user part of 'Registration Server'

setting.name: type
setting.description: private OR shared. If set to private, use standard call signaling. If set to shared, augment call signaling with call state subscriptions and notifications and use access control for outgoing calls.

setting.name: thirdPartyName
setting.description: This field must match the Address value of the other registration which makes up the bridged line.

setting.name: auth.userId
setting.description: User ID to be used for authentication challenges for this registration. If non-empty, will override the 'Reg User' parameter entered into the Authentication submenu off of the Settings menu on the phone.

setting.name: auth.password
setting.description: Password to be used for authentication challenges for this registration. If non-empty, will override the 'Reg Password' parameter entered into the Authentication submenu off of the Settings menu on the phone.

setting.name: address
setting.description: Primary Registration Server. IP address or host name of a SIP server that accepts registrations.

setting.name: port
setting.description: 0, empty, 1 to 65535

setting.name: transport
setting.description: DNSnaptr, TCPpreferred or UDPonly. If empty or DNSnaptr and if Address is a hostname and Port is 0 or empty, do NAPTR then SRV look-ups to try to discover the transport, ports and servers, as per RFC 3263. If Address is an IP address, or a port is given, then UDP is used. If set to TCPpreferred: TCP is the preferred transport, UDP is used if TCP fails. If set to UDPonly: Only UDP will be used.

setting.name: expires
setting.description: positive integer

setting.name: register
setting.description: 0, 1 enable registration

setting.name: address
setting.description: Primary Registration Server. IP address or host name of a SIP server that accepts registrations.

setting.name: port
setting.description: 0, empty, 1 to 65535

setting.name: transport
setting.description: DNSnaptr, TCPpreferred or UDPonly. If empty or DNSnaptr and if Address is a hostname and Port is 0 or empty, do NAPTR then SRV look-ups to try to discover the transport, ports and servers, as per RFC 3263. If Address is an IP address, or a port is given, then UDP is used. If set to TCPpreferred: TCP is the preferred transport, UDP is used if TCP fails. If set to UDPonly: Only UDP will be used.

setting.name: register
setting.description: 0, 1 enable registration

setting.name: retryTimeOut
setting.description: empty or non-negative integer

setting.name: retryMaxCount
setting.description: empty or non-negative integer

setting.name: expires.lineSeize
setting.description: positive integer

group.name: autoOffHook
group.label: Auto Off Hook/Ring Down
group.description: Phone will automatically dial this contact immediately upon lifting handset (or similiar operation with headset). This is useful for lobby phones or as a integration technique when interfacing with legacy PBXes that manage call state.

setting.name: enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, a call will be automatically placed to the contact specified upon going off hook on this registration.

setting.name: contact
setting.description: ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@domain.com)

setting.name: enabled
setting.description: If set to 0, all missed-call events will increment the counter If set to 1, only missed-call events sent by the server will increment the counter.

group.name: divert
group.label: Diversion
group.description: SoundPoint(R) IP contains a flexible call forward/diversion feature for this line. In all cases, a call will only be diverted if a non-empty contact has been configured.

setting.name: contact
setting.description: The forward-to contact used for all automatic call diversion features unless overridden by a specific contact of a per-call diversion feature.

setting.name: autoOnSpecificCaller
setting.description: If set to 1, calls may be diverted using the Auto Divert feature of the directory. This is a global flag.

setting.name: sharedDisabled
setting.description: If set to 1, all diversion features on this line will be disabled if the line is configured as shared.

setting.name: enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, the user will be able to enable universal call forwarding via the soft key menu.

setting.name: enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, calls will be forwarded on busy to the contact specified below.

setting.name: contact
setting.description: Forward-to contact for calls forwarded due to busy status, if empty, Contact will be used. ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@domain.com)

setting.name: enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, calls will be forwarded on no answer to the contact specified.

setting.name: timeout
setting.description: Time in seconds to allow altering before initiating the diversion.

setting.name: contact
setting.description: Forward-to contact used for calls forwarded due to no answer, if empty, Contact will be used. ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@domain.com)

setting.name: enabled
setting.description: If set to 1, calls will be forwarded on DND to the contact specified below.

setting.name: contact
setting.description: Forward-to contact used for calls forwarded due to DND status, if empty Contact will be used. ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@domain.com)

setting.name: impossibleMatchHandling
setting.description: When present, and if no digitmap setting are set, this attribute overrides the global dial plan in Dial Plan settings.

setting.name: removeEndOfDial
setting.description: When present, and if no digitmap setting are set, this attribute overrides the global dial plan in Dial Plan settings.

setting.name: digitmap
setting.description: When present, this attribute overrides the global dial plan defined Phone's Dial Plan settings

setting.name: digitmap.timeOut
setting.label: Time out
setting.description: When present, this attribute overrides the global dial plan defined Phone's Dial Plan settings

setting.name: address
setting.description: IP address or host name and port of a SIP server that will be used for routing calls.

setting.name: emergency.1.value
setting.label: Emergency Numbers
setting.description: This represents the URLs that should be watched for emergency routing. When one of these defined URL is detected as being dialed by the user, the call will be automatically directed to the defined emergency server.

group.name: msg.mwi
group.label: Messaging
group.description: SoundPoint(R) IP supports message-waiting indication on a per-registration basis.

setting.name: subscribe
setting.description: If non-empty, the phone will send a SUBSCRIBE request to this contact after boot-up. ASCII encoded string containing digits (the user part of a SIP URL) or a string that constitutes a valid SIP URL (6416 or 6416@domain.com)

setting.name: callBackMode
setting.description: contact, registration or disabled, If set to 'contact', a call will be placed to the contact specified in the callback attribute when the user invokes message retrieval. If set to 'registration', a call will be placed using this registration to the contact registered (the phone will call itself). If set to 'disabled', message retrieval is disabled.

setting.name: callBack
setting.description: Contact to call when retrieving messages for this registration.
